intro: Absolmsia spartioides, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its silvery-white, velvety leaves that help reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The tree is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental foliage.

It is commonly found in rocky outcrops, sandy soils, and along riverbanks in these areas. This species thrives in environments with low rainfall and high sunlight exposure. It is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Its distribution is largely restricted to specific ecological niches within the Kalahari and surrounding desert regions.
